title: Higher-order Szegő theorems with two singular points
abstract: We consider probability measures, dμ = w(θ)^(dθ)_(2π) + dμ_s, on the unit circle, ∂D, with Verblunsky coefficients, {αj}_(j=0)^∞. We prove for θ_1 ≠ θ_2 in [0,2π) that ∫[1-cos(θ-θ_1)][1-cos(θ-θ_2)]log w(θ)^(dθ)_(2π > -∞if and only if ∑_(j=0)^∞ │{(δ-e^(-iθ2))(δ-e^(-iθ1))α}_j^2 +|α_j|^4 < ∞,where δ is the left shift operator (δβ)_j = β_(j+1). We also prove that ∫(1-cosθ)^2 log w (θ)^(dθ)_(2π) > - ∞ if and only if ∑_(j=0)^∞|α_(j+2) - 2α_(j+1) + α_j|^2 + |αj|^ 6 <∞.

We thank S. Denisovand S. Kupin for telling us of their joint work [3].
keywords: Orthogonal polynomials on the unit circle; Szegő theorem
referencetext:
[1] P.A. Deift, R. Killip, On the absolutely continuous spectrum of one-dimensional Schrödinger operators with
square summable potentials, Comm. Math. Phys. 203 (1999) 341–347.
[2] S.A. Denisov,On the coexistence of absolutely continuous and singular continuous components of the spectral
measure for some Sturm–Liouville operators with square summable potential, J. Differential Equations 191
(2003) 90–104.
[3] S.A. Denisov, S. Kupin, Asymptotics of the orthogonal polynomials for the Szeg˝o class with a polynomial
weight, preprint.
[4] E. Gagliardo, Proprietà di alcune classi di funzioni in più variabili, Ricerche Mat. 7 (1958) 102–137.
[5] Ya.L. Geronimus, On polynomials orthogonal on the circle, on trigonometric moment problem, and on allied
Carathéodory and Schur functions, Mat. Sb. 15 (1944) 99–130 (in Russian).
[6] Ya.L. Geronimus, Orthogonal Polynomials: Estimates, Asymptotic Formulas, and Series of Polynomials
Orthogonal on the Unit Circle and on an Interval, Consultants Bureau, NewYork, 1961.
[7] R. Killip, B. Simon, Sum rules for Jacobi matrices and their applications to spectral theory, Ann. Math. 158
(2) (2003) 253–321.
[8] S. Kupin, On sum rules of special form for Jacobi matrices, C. R. Math. Acad. Sci. Paris 336 (2003) 611–
614.
[9] S. Kupin, On a spectral property of Jacobi matrices, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 132 (2004) 1377–1383.
[10] A. Laptev, S. Naboko, O. Safronov,On new relations between spectral properties of Jacobi matrices and their
coefficients, Comm. Math. Phys. 241 (2003) 91–110.
[11] F. Nazarov, F. Peherstorfer, A. Volberg, P.Yuditskii, On generalized sum rules for Jacobi matrices, preprint.
[12] L. Nirenberg, On elliptic partial differential equations, Ann. Scuola Norm. Pisa 13 (1959) 116–162.
[13] E.A. Rakhmanov, The asymptotic behavior of the ratio of orthogonal polynomials II, Mat. Sb. 118 (1982)
104–117.
[14] B. Simon, A canonical factorization for meromorphic Herglotz functions on the unit disk and sum rules for
Jacobi matrices, J. Funct. Anal. 214 (2004) 396–409.
[15] B. Simon, Orthogonal Polynomials on the Unit Circle, Part 1: Classical Theory, AMS Colloquium
Publications, vol. 54.1, American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, in press.
[16] B. Simon, Orthogonal Polynomials on the Unit Circle, Part 2: Spectral Theory,AMSColloquium Publications,
vol. 54.2, American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, in press.
[17] B. Simon, A. Zlatoš, Sum rules and the Szeg˝o condition for orthogonal polynomials on the real line, Comm.
Math. Phys. 242 (2003) 393–423.
[18] G. Szeg˝o, Orthogonal Polynomials, American Mathematical Society Colloquium Publications, vol. 23, third
ed., American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, 1939, 1967.
[19] S. Verblunsky, On positive harmonic functions (second paper), Proc. London Math. Soc. 40 (2) (1936) 290–
320.
[20] A. Zlatoš, Sum rules for Jacobi matrices and divergent Lieb–Thirring sums, J. Funct. Anal., to appear.
